intro: Cryptantha muricata, commonly known as the rough cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Cryptantha muricata is often found in foothill and desert regions, where it thrives in full sun.
